creator: siffemoz

content:
A suggestion: if you use Windows, you can set two icons on desktop, each with this syntax in the icon properties: 

 thunderbird.exe -profilemgr "c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird\profiles\<yourprofile>"

But the profile mgr approach works too, but with the extra prompt. More info at 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/profile-manager-create-and-remove-thunderbird-profiles

Changing releases of Thunderbird should have no effect.
creator: davidsk

content: View (Alt-V) - Layout - Classic View You can toggle the message pane by pressing F8.
creator: christ1

content:
How do I make it stop?

This is Google asking to grant permission for Thunderbird to access your Gmail account as part of the OAuth2 authentication. If you want to use Thunderbird to access your Gmail account you'll have to "Allow" this. Simple as that. Before OAuth2 authentication has been introduced Thunderbird had unlimited access to your Gmail account regardless, without even asking for permission. Did you complain about that?

I DO NOT WANT to grant access for the list of dangerous purposes provided in the pop-up.

There is nothing dangerous about allowing access for Thunderbird.
creator: christ1

content: If you set the account as IMAP, that is exactly what will happen .

content: I have this problem, I'm using Thunderbird 140.0.1 eclipse on macos 15.5 sequoia, I dont see a "New Address Book option
creator: alan.twigg

content: In an Address Book tab the button to create a new address book is located in the left pane at the top left corner, right next to the left of the big blue 'New Contact' button. Unfortunately the button is invisible in TB v140.0. Starting from the big blue button, hover with the mouse to the left until you see a tool tip 'Create a new address book', then click. This will be fixed in TB 140.1.0 to be released next week.
creator: christ1
